channel.title: Saint Etienne on mattischrome
channel.description: Recent content in Saint Etienne on mattischrome

item.title: Album Digest, June 2012
item.description: Three fantastic albums for Album Digest June 2012: Saint Etienne Words and Music by Saint Etienne Liars WIXIW Hot Chip In Our Heads This month is a curious selection in that the albums are all by bands that I already own a few records by. When there is so much other directly related material that you can write about, it makes focussing on the album in hand quite difficult. I am always thinking up rankings and comparisons.

item.title: Understated Classics #9: Tiger Bay by Saint Etienne
item.description: Background Tiger Bay is Saint Etienne’s third album and I think it is among their best. It was released in June 1994 on Heavenly records. I first owned a copy in 1998 when I picked it up while living in halls as an undergraduate. The reason for including this album in the understated classics series is the same as for Second Light by Dreadzone: it marries traditional forms to newer electronic music1.

item.title: Album Digest, March 2011
item.description: This is not an Album Digest March 2011 Well as I said at the end of last monthâ€™s album digest post, I took a bit of a break from pursuing new music quite as closely as I have been. As promised, I sidestepped the new R.E.M. and Elbow albums - although I had been promised the latter as a birthday present it is yet to show up, maybe I will look at in April.
